result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Jarentowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason M Jarentowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason M Jarentowski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jason M Jarentowski was found guilty of Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Jason M Jarentowski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
CONCURRENT AS TO EACH COUNT

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/15/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, any remainder to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Cash bail applied.
- Pay supervision fees.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to his DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO EACH COUNT:
- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim until the defendant meets with his agent. The No Contact may be modified to No Violent Contact with agent approval.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent not in court.
There is an apprehension warrant out for the defendant.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 2 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Court will wait to hear from the agent to see if he wants another hearing.

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to count 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 6 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the defendant meets with his agent.  The no contact may be modified to no violent contact with agent approval.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
.
As to count 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 150 days in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the defendant meets with his agent.  The no contact may be modified to no violent contact with agent approval.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
.
As to count 5:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the defendant meets with his agent.  The no contact may be modified to no violent contact with agent approval.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a trial today.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing continued....
.
As to counts 1, 2 and 5:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 3 and 4:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 3 and 4 dismissed.
.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Jason M Jarentowski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 4 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Count 4.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1 & 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

CASE RECALLED AT THE HOUR OF 11:15 AM.  SAME APPEARANCES.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
